Rules Text: **Cost: 3, Combat: 9, Move: 2, Capacity: 8**|SUSTAIN DAMAGE
Aliases: adv carrier 2, adv carrier ii, advanced carrier 2

Rules Text: Other players cannot move ships through systems that contain your structures.|Each planet that contains 1 or more of your structures gains the PRODUCTION 1 ability as if it were a unit.
After you or one of your neighbors activates a system that is adjacent to an anomaly, you may apply +1 to the move value of all of that player's ships during this tactical action.

When you research a unit upgrade technology, you may exhaust this card to ignore any 1 prerequisite.|When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION, you may exhaust this card to reduce the combined cost of the produced units by the number of unit upgrade technologies that you own.
Your ships can move into and through asteroid fields.|When other players' units use SPACE CANNON against your units, apply -1 to the result of each die roll.
At the start of a space combat in a system that contains 3 or more of your non-fighter ships, your opponent must destroy 1 of his non-fighter ships.
At the end of the status phase, you may remove any number of infantry from planets you control and place them on 1 or more planets you control in the same or adjacent systems.
You may exhaust this card at the end of your turn to ready 1 of your planets that has a technology specialty or 1 of your other technologies.
**Cost: 3, Combat: 9, Move: 2, Capacity: 6**

Other players cannot activate asteroid fields that contain 1 or more of your ships.|At the start of your turn, you may produce 1 unit in a system that contains at least 1 of your units with PRODUCTION.

**Cost: 1 (x2), Combat: 7**|After this unit is destroyed, gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good. Then, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.
Aliases: crimson legionnaire 2, cl 2, cl ii, cl2

Rules Text: **Cost: 2, Combat: 6, Move: 3, Capacity: 1**
After you win a ground combat, you may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on that planet.

After you perform a tactical action in a system that contains a frontier token, if you have 1 or more ships in that system, explore that token.|Your ships can retreat into adjacent systems that do not contain other players' units, even if you do not have units or control planets in that system.
**Cost: 1, Combat: 8, Move: 2**|ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE 6 (x3)
At the start of a space combat in a system that contains a wormhole and 1 or more of your ships, you may produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ships.

This system is a gravity rift; your ships do not roll for this gravity rift. Place a dimensional tear token beneath this unit as a reminder.|Up to 12 fighters in this system do not count against your ships' capacity.|PRODUCTION 7
Aliases: dimensional tear 2, dt ii, dt2, dt 2

Rules Text: **Cost: 4, Combat: 5, Move: 2, Capacity: 1**|This unit cannot be destroyed by "Direct Hit" action cards.|SUSTAIN DAMAGE, BOMBARDMENT 5
During each combat round, after you assign hits to your units, repair 1 of your damaged units that did not use SUSTAIN DAMAGE during this combat round.
Notes: Applies only after the "Assign Hits" step

Rules Text: After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships, gain 4 trade goods.
Aliases: eres siphons, eres, e res, e res siphons

Rules Text: **Cost: 4, Combat: 5, Move: 2, Capacity: 1**|This unit cannot be destroyed by "Direct Hit" action cards. After a round of space combat, you may destroy this unit to destroy up to 2 ships in this system.|SUSTAIN DAMAGE, BOMBARDMENT 4 (x2)
**Cost: 1 (x2), Combat: 8, Move: 2**|This unit may move without being transported. Fighters in excess of your ships' capacity count against your fleet pool.
During each of your turns during the action phase, you may perform 2 actions instead of 1.
**Move: 2, Capacity: 5**|This unit is placed in a space area instead of on a planet. This unit can move and retreat as if it were a ship. If this unit is blockaded, it is destroyed.|PRODUCTION 7

You may exhaust this card before a player casts votes; that player must cast at least 1 vote for an outcome of your choice or remove 1 token from their fleet pool and return it to their reinforcements.
You may exhaust this card before 1 or more of your units use SPACE CANNON; hits produced by those units must be assigned to non-fighter ships if able.
After you activate a system, apply +1 to the move value of 1 of your ships during this tactical action.
Exhaust this card when 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION; swap the resource and influence values of 1 planet you control during that use of PRODUCTION.

**Combat: 6**|This unit is treated as both a structure and a ground force. It cannot be transported. You may use this unit's SPACE CANNON against ships that are adjacent to this unit's systems.|PLANETARY SHIELD, SPACE CANNON 5, SUSTAIN DAMAGE, PRODUCTION 1
Aliases: hel-titan 2, hel titan ii, hel titan 2

Rules Text: **Cost: 1 (x2), Combat: 7, Move: 2**|This unit may move without being transported. Each fighter in excess of your ships' capacity counts as 1/2 of a ship against your fleet pool.
During the status phase, gain 3 command tokens instead of 2.

At the start of a space combat, you may destroy 1 of your cruisers or destroyers in the active system to produce 1 hit against your opponent's ships; that hit must be assigned by your opponent to 1 of his non-fighter ships if able.

**Cost: 1 (x2), Combat: 7**|After this unit is destroyed, roll 1 die. If the result is 6 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of the next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.
Notes: If you do not control a planet in your home system at the start of your next turn, the unit is returned to your reinforcements.

Rules Text: You may exhaust this card and spend 2 resources when you research a technology;ignore all of that technology's prerequisites.
You may exhaust this card and spend 1 token from your strategy pool when another player plays an action card; cancel that action card.
After you gain control of a planet, you may produce any number of units on that planet that have a combined cost equal to or less than that planet's resource value.
During an invasion, units cannot use SPACE CANNON against your units.

During your tactical actions, if you do not control Mecatol Rex, treat its system as if it contains both an alpha and a beta wormhole.|Action: If you control Mecatol Rex, you may exhaust this card to place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on Mecatol Rex.

**Cost: 1 (x2), Combat: 7**|After this unit is destroyed, roll 1 die. If the result is 6 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of the next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.|Production 2
Notes: If you do not control a planet in your home system at the start of your next turn, the unit is returned to your reinforcements.

Rules Text: Your ships can move through systems that contain other players' ships.

You may exhaust this card at the start of a round of ground combat on a planet that contains 1 or more of your units with PLANETARY SHIELD; your opponent cannot make combat rolls during this combat round.
Notes: See also: Magen Defense Grid Omega

Rules Text: At the start of ground combat on a planet that contains 1 or more of your structures, you may produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ground forces.
Action: Exhaust this card to look at another player's hand of action cards. Choose 1 of those cards and add it to your hand.
Your ships can move into supernovas.|After 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION in a system that either contains a war sun or is adjacent to a supernova, gain 1 trade good.
Your ships can move into supernovas.|Each supernova that contains 1 or more of your units gains the PRODUCTION 5 ability as if it were 1 of your units.
**Cost: 8, Combat: 5 (x2), Move: 2, Capacity: 6**|You may treat this unit as if it were adjacent to systems that contain 1 or more of your mechs.| SUSTAIN DAMAGE, ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE 5 (x3)
When you spend trade goods, each trade good is worth 2 resources or 2 influence instead of 1.
During the status phase, draw 2 action cards instead of 1.
After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships, that player removes 1 token from his fleet pool and returns it to his reinforcements.
When 1 of your units uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE, cancel 2 hits instead of 1.
After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships, you may exhaust this card and spend 1 token from your strategy pool; immediately end that player's turn.
You may use this unit's SPACE CANNON against ships that are adjacent to this unit's systems.|PLANETARY SHIELD, SPACE CANNON 5
When 1 or more of your units use BOMBARDMENT or SPACE CANNON, 1 of those units may roll 1 additional die.

At the end of your turn, you may exhaust this card to redistribute your command tokens.|When you cast votes during the agenda phase, you may cast 3 additional votes; if you do, and the outcome you voted for is not resolved, exhaust this card.
After you explore a planet, ready that planet.
Aliases: prefab arcologies, prefab, pre fab arcologies

Rules Text: Action: Exhaust this card and spend 1 token from your strategy pool to gain 4 trade goods and choose 1 other player; that player gains 2 trade goods.
**Cost: 10, Combat: 3 (x3), Move: 3, Capacity: 6**|Other player's units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD.|SUSTAIN DAMAGE, BOMBARDMENT 3 (x3)

You can use technology specialties on planets you control without exhausting them, even if those planets are exhausted.|During the action phase, you can exhaust planets you control that have technology specialties to gain 1 trade good.

At the end of the strategy phase, you may spend 1 token from your strategy pool give another player 3 trade goods. If you do, give 1 of your strategy cards to that player and take 1 of his strategy cards.
After you win or lose a space combat, gain 1 trade good; if you won the combat, you may also produce 1 ship of any type that was destroyed during that combat.
When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION, reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.
**Cost: 2, Combat: 6, Move: 3, Capacity: 2**|SUSTAIN DAMAGE
Aliases: saturn engine 2, se ii, se 2, se2

Rules Text: When you activate a system, you may explore 1 planet in that system that contains 1 or more of your units.

After 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION, you may exhaust this card to place 1 mech from your reinforcements on a planet you control in that system.|After 1 of your mechs is destroyed, gain 1 trade good.
Aliases: sar, self assembly routines, self assembly

Rules Text: Action: Exhaust this card to produce 1 ship in any system that contains 1 of your space docks.
This unit's PRODUCTION value is equal to 4 more than the resource value of this planet.|Up to 3 fighters in this system do not count against your ships' capacity.|PRODUCTION X
You may exhaust this card after you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your units; that system is adjacent to all systems that contain 1 or more of your units during this activation.

**Cost: 1 (x2), Combat: 6**|After this unit is destroyed, roll 1 die. If the result is 5 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of the next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.
Notes: If you do not control a planet in your home system at the start of your next turn, the unit is returned to your reinforcements.

Rules Text: **Cost: 1, Combat: 8, Move: 2, Capacity: 1**|When this unit uses ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, each result of 9 or 10 also destroys 1 of your opponent's infantry in the space area of the active system.|ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE 6 (x3)

Rules Text: At the start of a combat round, you may exhaust this card to apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat round.
**Cost: 4, Combat: 4, Move: 2, Capacity: 2**|This unit cannot be destroyed by "Direct Hit" action cards.|SUSTAIN DAMAGE, BOMBARDMENT 4
Aliases: superdread 2, superdreadnought 2, superdread ii, superdreadnought ii, super dreadnought 2, super dreadnought ii

Rules Text: After any player's agent becomes exhausted, you may exhaust this card to ready that agent; if you ready another player's agent, you may perform a transaction with that player.
You may exhaust this card at the start of your turn during the action phase; remove up to 4 of your ground forces from the game board and place them on 1 or more planets you control.
During your turn of the action phase, players that have passed cannot play action cards.

When you would gain another player's technology using 1 of your faction abilities, you may place the "X" assimilator token on a faction technology owned by that player instead. While that token is on a technology, this card gains that technology's text. You cannot place an assimilator token on a technology that already has an assimilator token.

When you would gain another player's technology using 1 of your faction abilities, you may place the "Y" assimilator token on a faction technology owned by that player instead. While that token is on a technology, this card gains that technology's text. You cannot place an assimilator token on a technology that already has an assimilator token.
After making combat rolls during a round of ground combat, if your opponent produced 1 or more hits, you produce 1 additional hit.
After a player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your units, they must give you 1 promissory note from their hand, if able.
Action: Exhaust this card to choose another player's non-structure unit in a system that is adjacent to 1 or more of your space docks. Capture 1 unit of that type from that player's reinforcements.
**Cost: 12, Combat: 3 (x3), Move: 2, Capacity: 6**|Other player's units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD.|SUSTAIN DAMAGE, BOMBARDMENT 3 (x3)
At the start of the status phase, place or move a Creuss wormhole token into either a system that contains a planet you control or a non-home system that does not contain another player's ships.
Action: Exhaust this card to place or move a Creuss wormhole token into either a system that contains a planet you control or a non-home system that does not contain another player's ships.
*Action:* Exhaust this card and choose 1 planet in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships that have BOMBARDMENT; destroy all infantry on that planet.
Notes: See also: X-89 Bacterial Weapon Omega

Rules Text: After 1 or more of your units use BOMBARDMENT against a planet, if at least 1 of your opponent's infantry was destroyed, you may destroy all of your opponent's infantry on that planet.
Notes: Updated to be optional in Codex
Aliases: x89 omega, x89 bacterial weapon omega

Rules Text: After 1 or more of your units uses PRODUCTION, place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on a planet you control in that system.
After you produce units, place up to 2 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control or in any space area that contains 1 or more of your ships.
